This JRE came in the WSWB 3.0M7 bundle that used to be available from the 
Toronto build pages. I think this was the 200402201433 build. I don't know 
where you guys got it from. 

I recognized (from the version info) that it was probably a pre-release 
version, but figured you should know sooner rather than later that there was a 
problem with it.

I noticed that the WSWB 3.0M8 bundle I pulled last week has fallen all the way 
back to IBM JRE 1.3.1, which is rather astonishing. This is the wswb-I20040304-
200403081720 bundle.

This is because the xercesc impl between JDK 1.4.2 is different than the impl 
inside the org.apache.xerces_4.0.13.

The methods set/getEncoding() and set/getVersion() have been changed to 
set/getXmlEncoding() and set/getXmlVersion() according to the Apache Xerces2 
implementation spec.

Fix checked into the HEAD stream.

The config generator will now use java reflection to resolve the methods and 
invoke the ones supported by the xerces used. We cannot simply use the new 
methods because it will break the backward compatibility.
